channel.title: Help with easy rsc
channel.description: i got my sever so it gets online but i dont know how to make an acc so i can log in how do i do this?

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

::item <id> <amount
::npc <id>

All the commands you are able to use will be in the CommandHandler.java (server side). As for sounds, I am not sure. It’s not something i’ve looked into, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Prayer IDs:

0: Thick skin 1: Burst of strength 2: Clarity of thought 3: Rock skin 4: Superhuman strength 5: Improved reflexes 6: Rapid restore 7: Rapid heal 8: Protect items 9: Steel skin 10: Ultimate strength 11: Incredible reflexes 12: Paralyze monster 13: Protect from missiles

Stat IDs:

0: Attack 1: Defense 2: Strength 3: Hits 4: Ranged 5: Prayer 6: Magic 7: Cooking 8: Woodcut 9: Fletching 10: Fishing 11: Firemaking 12: Crafting 13: Smithing 14: Mining 15: Herblaw 16: Agility 17: Thieving

Spell IDs

0: Wind strike 1: Confuse 2: Water strike 3: Enchant lvl-1 amulet 4: Earth strike 5: Weaken 6: Fire strike 7: Bones to bananas 8: Wind bolt 9: Curse 10: Low level alchemy 11: Water bolt 12: Varrock teleport 13: Enchant lvl-2 amulet 14: Earth bolt 15: Lumbridge teleport 16: Telekinetic grab 17: Fire bolt 18: Falador teleport 19: Crumble undead 20: Wind blast 21: Superheat item 22: Camelot teleport 23: Water blast 24: Enchant lvl-3 amulet 25: Iban blast 26: Ardougne teleport 27: Earth blast 28: High level alchemy 29: Charge Water Orb 30: Enchant lvl-4 amulet 31: Watchtower teleport 32: Fire blast 33: Claws of Guthix 34: Saradomin strike 35: Flames of Zamorak 36: Charge earth Orb 37: Wind wave 38: Charge Fire Orb 39: Water wave 40: Charge air Orb 41: Vulnerability 42: Enchant lvl-5 amulet 43: Earth wave 44: Enfeeble 45: Fire wave 46: Stun 47: Charge

I haven’t come across anything about quests publically released, so try and work on one yourself. Adding quest list in the game where the “Info” options are is done in the mudclient.java (client side).

Visuals and graphics are possible Check out Dark Quest.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @Dylan4755 Dylan4755
item.description:
@Dylan4755 wrote:

Hey thanks alot, i got a few things things first in doc sever side theres no skill ids theres just items, npc, and objects. Also how do i make sound work and how do i add quests and make a quest section in game. Also once i add quests and get all skills and bugs worked out i plan on completely changeing the visuals of the game kinda like updateing the graphixs does this sound possible?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Dylan4755, post:10, topic:269876”]Wooooooooooot ok got it thanks you guys rock. just got a few questions on modifying it such as were can i find skill and items id to give to my acc also can i have some tips on modifying things such a were ::stuck takes me. also i fiugerd out how to get items go to sever set up page thing were you turn it on and of click char nand in doc s a list of items but can iui give my self admin powers so i can do this in game if so how.
Thanks[/quote]

You’re welcome

To edit the command ::stuck, you will have to search for it in the CommandHandler.java which is server side. Search for “stuck” and change the coords that are in player.teleport(x, y).

To make your rank, you need to go into the players folder, that is also server side. Find the name of your account name. Open it in wordpad. Search for “rank” and then change that from 0 to one of the numbers listed below.

0 = Normal player
2 = Pmod (green crown)
3 = Mod (silver crown)
4 = Admin (yellow crown)
5 = Muted
6 = Banned

Items can be modified in the ItemsDef.xml that is located server side in the defs folder. Note: Anything you change in this file will also require you to change the Items.rscd file (client side) to exactly the same.

Also, if you are wanting to change specific stats of an item once it has been wielded, then that is done in the ItemsWieldableDef.xml which is server side.

As Blade said, all item, object, npc and skill IDs can be found in the “docs” folder.

Once you have made yourself Admin, you can use the in-game command ::item to spawn yourself items.

Good luck, and remember; if you have anymore questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us

Take care, Dylan.

Regards,

Yong-Min

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @Bladex0x Bladex0x
item.description:
@Bladex0x wrote:

To give yourself admin go to players then your username and find rights, then change them to 4. For finding item, npc, and object ids. Go to docs, And you will see objects, npcs, and items which inside of those are the ids.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Dylan4755, post:8, topic:269876”]I guess I would be wanting to play on a local host cause I just want to play alone not with others online. Also about the paths Im guessing your talking about my ip being in the right place to connect once again I thought I had it right but when I go to log in I get the cant connect or whatever it says also when I go to play do I go to distributed or the client? is it true that once I get it all set up I just type what I want username and pass to be and it automatically makes it and logs me in?
Thank you for your time Im new at this but I wish to learn.[/quote]

Make sure you have “server=localhost” in your settings.ini

Yes, you can just make a username and log in, however it sounds like you’re using the newest version of EasyRSC, so you can not have spaces in the username.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @Dylan4755 Dylan4755
item.description:

Also about the paths I’m guessing your talking about my ip being in the right place to connect once again I thought I had it right but when I go to log in I get the cant connect or whatever it says also when I go to play do I go to distributed or the client? is it true that once I get it all set up I just type what I want username and pass to be and it automatically makes it and logs me in?
Thank you for your time I’m new at this but I wish to learn.

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Dylan4755, post:6, topic:269876”]ok well for some reason it just not working will someone be so kind and give me a guide how to set this up useing easyrsc i know how to download and all that just playing is the problem.
Thanks[/quote]

Here are a few questions:

  1. Did you set your paths correctly?

  2. Are you wanting to play localhost or go public?

  3. Are you getting any errors when you try login/run it? If so, post the errors.

item.title: Help with easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Bladex0x, post:4, topic:269876”][quote author=yong min link=topic=356212.msg2725086#msg2725086 date=1238277931]

Topic: help with easy rsc

With EasyRSC, you just enter any desired username and password and hit login ^^

That will automatically create that account for you. You can then find the account created in the players folder.

[edit] If you’re using the newest version of EasyRSC, you can’t have spaces in the username.
[/quote]I’m dumb lol the title explains it :)[/quote]

It did indeed

Read full topic
